net.sf.ntru.arith

Class SchönhageStrassen

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.ntru.arith.SchönhageStrassen

  • public class SchönhageStrassen
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the Schönhage-Strassen algorithm for multiplying large numbers.

    References:

    1. Arnold Schönhage und Volker Strassen: Schnelle Multiplikation großer Zahlen, Computing 7, 1971, Springer-Verlag, S. 281–292
    2. Eine verständliche Beschreibung des Schönhage-Strassen-Algorithmus

    Numbers are internally represented as int arrays; the ints are interpreted as unsigned numbers.

    • Method Detail

      • mult

        public static java.math.BigInteger mult(java.math.BigInteger a,
                        java.math.BigInteger b)
        Multiplies two BigIntegers using the Schönhage-Strassen algorithm.
        Karatsuba is used instead of Schönhage-Strassen if the numbers are in a range where Karatsuba is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        a BigInteger equal to a.multiply(b)

      • mult

        public static int[] mult(int[] a,
         int[] b)
        Multiplies two positive numbers represented as int arrays, i.e. in base 2^32. Positive means an int is always interpreted as an unsigned number, regardless of the sign bit.
        The arrays must be ordered least significant to most significant, so the least significant digit must be at index 0.
        Schönhage-Strassen is used unless the numbers are in a range where Karatsuba is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        Returns:
        a*b

      • toIntArray

        public static int[] toIntArray(java.math.BigInteger a)
        Converts a BigInteger to an int array.
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:
        an int array that is compatible with the mult() methods

      • toBigInteger

        public static java.math.BigInteger toBigInteger(int[] a)
        Converts a int array to a BigInteger.
        Parameters:
        a -
        Returns:
        the BigInteger representation of the array
